hanzi-su-wiki:
繭

Значения

Кокон (шелкопряда)

Мнемоника

Червяк 虫 шелкопряда питается травой 艹 или листьями, а его кокон обмотан нитками 糸, из которых делают ткань 巾.

Варианты

茧
purpleculture_pinyin:
jiǎn
cocoon; callus
кокон; мозоль
rtega_mnemonic:
繭繭RS
茧茧		cocoon, callus, blister
  • RS. silk cocoon resembling grass 艹 and making fabric 巾 from thread 糸 of an insect 虫: cocoons
  • ⓢ insect 虫 spinning itself in a grass 艹 like fabric: cocoon
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 茧)
Ideographic: A silk 糹 cocoon 冂 spun by a worm 虫
purpleculture_examples: 繭子 [ jiǎn zi ]: callus (patch or hardened skin); corns (on feet); also 趼子

heisig_chinese_memo: This is a simple two-column manga showing the metamorphosis of a caterpillar into a cocoon. First, the caterpillar gets under a large flower. Then, in the first frame, we see the caterpillar (insect). Then, a bar separating this frame from the next frame (remember that Japanese manga run the other way!), in which we see the insect covered with thread, making a beautiful cocoon.
heisig_constituent: cocoon, flowers, hood, stick, thread, spiderman, insect
heisig_story: Though it's a good thing that the primitive for cocoon has been radically abbreviated from this, its full form as a kanji, the story it holds is a charming one. The silkworm (insect) eats the leaves of the mulberry bush (the flowers), digests them and transforms them into thread with which it spins about itself, in mystic wisdom, its own coffin (the hood). The dividing line that separates the two elements helps the picture of the little worm cutting itself off from contact with the outside world, but as a character stroke, it is a clear exception.
koohiiStory1: This is a simple two-column manga showing the metamorphosis of a caterpillar into a cocoon. First, the caterpillar gets under a large flower (bees tend to hang around flowers, which scare away other predators). Then, in the first frame, we see the caterpillar (insect). Then, a bar separating this frame from the next frame (remember that Japanese manga run the other way!), in which we see the insect covered with thread, making a beautiful cocoon.
koohiiStory2: The magic flower is the reason why Spider-Man ended up miniaturized and confined inside a hood-like cocoon together with an insect. Now, only a walking stick separates them both.
Ru_Radicals: 冂 (перевёрнутая коробка), 小 (маленький), 幺 (короткая нить), 艾 (мокса), 糸 (нить), 虫 (насекомое), 風 (ветер)
Ru_trainchinese: jiǎn: (сущ) кокон; мозоль на ноге (то же самое, что 趼)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the turban (巾) made of thread (糸) for the insect (虫) under the grass (艹) = a cocoon
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: An insect is like the flower and its cocoon is like the rest of the tree.  The insect grows out of the cocoon just like the flower grows out of the tree.
humanum_full_description_en:
From "糸", from " worm ", from "黹" province, the original meaning is the shell made of silkworm or other insects before they become pupae. "Shuowen": "Silkworm clothing. From the silkworm to the worms, and from the worm. The ancient Chinese cocoon is from the silkworm. See." , To serve as the service of a shared suburban temple."

" Cocoon " can mean silk thread. One of Zhang Huang's "He Yu Zhan's Original Rhyme on the Sea" of the Ming Dynasty: "It's not a lonely official who is willing to make a fishing rod alone.
humanum_short_description_en: From "糸", from " worm ", from the province of "黹", the original meaning is the shell made of silkworm or other insects before the pupae.
humanum_full_description:
從「糸」，從「虫」，從「黹」省，本義為蠶或其他昆蟲成蛹前吐絲做成的殼。《說文》：「蠶衣也。从糸从虫，黹省。絸，古文繭从糸、見。」 《禮記‧月令》：「（季春之月）蠶事既登，分繭稱絲，效功以共郊廟之服。」

　　「繭」可表示絲線。明張煌言〈和于湛之海上原韻〉之一：「不是孤臣甘浪跡，肯將獨繭着漁竿。」
humanum_short_description: 從「糸」，從「虫」，從「黹」省，本義為蠶或其他昆蟲成蛹前吐絲做成的殼。

從「 糸 」，從「 虫 」，從「 黹 」省，本義為蠶或其他昆蟲成蛹前吐絲做成的殼。《說文》：「蠶衣也。从糸从虫，黹省。絸，古文繭从糸、見。」 《禮記‧月令》：「（季春之月）蠶事既登，分繭稱絲，效功以共郊廟之服。」 「 繭 」可表示絲線。明張煌言〈和于湛之海上原韻〉之一：「不是孤臣甘浪跡，肯將獨繭着漁竿。」
From " 糸", from " worm", from " 黹" province, the original meaning is the shell made of silkworm or other insects before they become pupae. "Shuowen": "Silkworm clothing. From the silkworm to the worms, and from the worm. The ancient Chinese cocoon is from the silkworm. See." , To serve as the service of a shared suburban temple." " Cocoon" can mean silk thread. One of Zhang Huang's "He Yu Zhan's Original Rhyme on the Sea" of the Ming Dynasty: "It's not a lonely official who is willing to make a fishing rod alone.

繭字的基本解释

繭
jiǎn
见“茧”。

繭字的汉语字典释义

[①]［jiǎn］
［《廣韻》古典切，上銑，見。］
“茧1”的繁体字。亦作“絸1”。亦作“蠒1”。
(1)完全变态昆虫蛹期的囊状保护物，通常由丝腺分泌的丝织成，多为黄色或白色，如家蚕和柞蚕的茧。
(2)指茧丝。
(3)絮丝绵的衣服。后作“襺”。
(4)形状如茧的。参见“繭栗”。
(5)见“繭繭”。
(6)通“趼”。手掌或脚掌等部位因摩擦而生成的硬皮。

繭字的康熙字典解释

【未集中】【糸字部】　繭； 康熙笔画：19； 页码：页940第11
〔古文〕絸【廣韻】古典切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】吉典切，?音趼。【說文】蠶衣也。【禮·祭義】世婦卒蠶，奉繭以示于君，遂獻繭于夫人。　又【釋名】煑繭曰幕。貧者著衣，可以幕絡絮也。或謂之牽離，煑熟爛，牽引使離散如綿然也。【禮·玉藻】纊爲繭，縕爲袍。　又繭繭，聲氣微也。【禮·玉藻】言容繭繭。【疏】猶綿綿，聲氣微細繭繭然。　又【戰國策】足重繭而不休息。【註】足傷皮皺，如蠶繭也。　【類篇】或作?。俗作蠒，非是。

考證：〔【釋名】繭曰幕也。〕　謹照太平御覽引釋名原文改爲煑繭曰幕，或謂牽離。謹照釋名原文謂下增之字。

暂无。

cocoon
Basic explanation of words
cocoon
jiǎn
See "cocoon".
cocoon
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［jiǎn］
["Guangyun" classical cut, milling, see. ]
Traditional characters for "cocoon 1". Also known as "絸1". Also known as "Collardium 1".
(1) The sac-like protective material in the pupal stage of completely metamorphic insects is usually woven from silk secreted by silk glands, and is mostly yellow or white, such as the cocoons of silkworm and tussah.
(2) Refers to cocoon silk.
(3) Susimian clothes. Later called "Xu".
(4) Shaped like a cocoon. See "cocoon chestnut".
(5) See "Cocoon".
(6) Through "趼". Crusty skin on the palms or soles of the feet due to friction.
cocoon

Or it is called pull away, ripened and rotten, and traction makes the separation like a spongy. 【Rite·Yuzao】The 纩 is a cocoon, and the 縕 is a robe.　Cocoon again, with a slight voice. 【Li·Yuzao】Speaking and cocooning. 【Sparse】Still continuous, with a subtle voice.　[Warring States Policy] The cocoon does not rest.
